list_definition.definition: (of) the soft hair of sheep and some other animals, often made into yarn etc for knitting or into fabric for making clothes etc

list_ex_of_english: A man is told to pick out all the green wools in one case and all the blue wools in another.
The list covers knitting wools, hand-knit garments and machine-knitted garments, and tweed.
The wools had also subsequently been washed.
The wool study was unfinished at the time the book became ready, and was not included in it.
The worsted spinners, however, who produce the bulk of these wools, have been given preference in the supply of fuel, and output is already increasing again.
Effects of shearing interval on fleece weight and wool growth on a delineated midside patch.
Second, wool production and wool usage tended to separate.
The primary participants in wool weaving were the shepherds.
